chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Robert Gutting is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9:58 a.m.  Defendant Joshua Robert Gutting in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Includes 14CT61, 15CF63 and 15CF154.  Froelich - PSI on 15CF154, 15CF63 - Ct 1, dismiss but read in for restitution, Ct. 2 - dismiss.  15CF57 dismissed.  14CT61 - dismissed.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 in 15CF154.      Facts are correct.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1 in 15CF154.  Court dismisses 15CF63, Ct. 2, dismisses, Ct 1 shall be read in for restitution purposes but dismissed.  14CT61 shall be dismissed.  15CF57 dismissed.  Appeal rights given.  Bond to continue.  Bond conditions reviewed with defendant.
